buildings.name: Assembler
buildings.description: Crafts two parts into another part.\n\nCan be automated by feeding parts into it with a conveyor belt connected to the input. The produced parts can be automatically extracted by connecting a conveyor belt to the output.

buildings.name: Constructor
buildings.description: Crafts one part into another part.\n\nCan be automated by feeding parts into it with a conveyor belt connected to the input. The produced parts can be automatically extracted by connecting a conveyor belt to the output.

buildings.name: Conveyor Merger
buildings.description: Merges up to three conveyor belts into one.

buildings.name: Programmable Splitter
buildings.description: Splits conveyor belts in three. \nYou can set rules for each output to decide exactly where each part should go.

buildings.name: Smart Splitter
buildings.description: Splits conveyor belts in three. \nYou can set a rule for which part should go to the left and which part should go to the right.

buildings.name: Conveyor Splitter
buildings.description: Splits conveyor belts in three. \nUseful to move parts and resources from oversaturated conveyor belts.

buildings.name: Conveyor Belt Mk.1
buildings.description: Transports up to 60 resources per minute. Used to move resources between buildings.

buildings.name: Conveyor Belt Mk.2
buildings.description: Transports up to 120 resources per minute. Used to move resources between buildings.

buildings.name: Conveyor Belt Mk.3
buildings.description: Transports up to 270 resources per minute. Used to move resources between buildings.

buildings.name: Conveyor Belt Mk.4
buildings.description: Transports up to 480 resources per minute. Used to move resources between buildings.

buildings.name: Conveyor Belt Mk.5
buildings.description: Transports up to 780 resources per minute. Used to move resources between buildings.

buildings.name: Conveyor Lift Mk.1
buildings.description: Transports up to 60 resources per minute. Used to move resources between floors.

buildings.name: Conveyor Lift Mk.2
buildings.description: Transports up to 120 resources per minute. Used to move resources between floors.

buildings.name: Conveyor Lift Mk.3
buildings.description: Transports up to 270 resources per minute. Used to move resources between floors.

buildings.name: Conveyor Lift Mk.4
buildings.description: Transports up to 480 resources per minute. Used to move resources between floors.

buildings.name: Conveyor Lift Mk.5
buildings.description: Transports up to 780 resources per minute. Used to move resources between floors.

buildings.name: Stackable Conveyor Pole
buildings.description: Conveyor pole with fixed size that is stackable

buildings.name: Conveyor Wall Mount
buildings.description: Can be attached to walls and is used as a connection for conveyor belts.\nUseful to route conveyor belts in a more controlled manner and over long distances.

buildings.name: Conveyor Pole
buildings.description: Can be used as a connection for conveyor belts. The height of the pole can be adjusted.\nUseful to route conveyor belts in a more controlled manner and over long distances.

buildings.name: Cyber Wagon
buildings.description: Absolutely indestructible.\nNeeds no further introduction.

buildings.name: Explorer
buildings.description: 24 slot inventory. Has a built in craft bench. Fast and nimble exploration vehicle. Tuned for really rough terrain and can climb almost vertical surfaces.

buildings.name: Fence
buildings.description: The Fence can be built on the edges of floors to prevent you from falling off.

buildings.name: Glass Foundation 8m x 1m
buildings.description: Provides a flat floor to build your factory on. \nBuildings on top of the foundation are adjusted to a grid, to make it easier to line them up to each other.

buildings.name: Foundation 8m x 1m
buildings.description: Provides a flat floor to build your factory on. \nBuildings on top of the foundation are adjusted to a grid, to make it easier to line them up to each other.

buildings.name: Foundation 8m x 2m
buildings.description: Provides a flat floor to build your factory on. \nBuildings on top of the foundation are adjusted to a grid, to make it easier to line them up to each other.

buildings.name: Foundation 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Provides a flat floor to build your factory on. \nBuildings on top of the foundation are adjusted to a grid, to make it easier to line them up to each other.

buildings.name: Frame Foundation 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Provides a flat floor to build your factory on. \nBuildings on top of the foundation are adjusted to a grid, to make it easier to line them up to each other.

buildings.name: Foundry
buildings.description: Smelts two resources into alloy ingots.\n\nCan be automated by feeding ore into it with a conveyor belt connected to the inputs. The produced ingots can be automatically extracted by connecting a conveyor belt to the output.

buildings.name: Freight Car
buildings.description: The Freight Car is used to transport large quantity of resources from one place to another. Resources are loaded or unloaded at Freight Platforms.\nMust be build on Railway.

buildings.name: Biomass Burner
buildings.description:
Burns various forms of biomass to generate electricity for the power grid.
Has no input and must therefore be fed biomass manually.

Resource consumption will automatically be lowered to meet power demands.

buildings.name: Coal Generator
buildings.description:
Burns Coal to boil Water, the produced steam rotates turbines to generate electricty for the power grid.
Has a Conveyor Belt and Pipe input, so both the Coal and Water supply can be automated.

Resource consumption will automatically be lowered to meet power demands.

buildings.name: Fuel Generator
buildings.description:
Consumes Fuel to generate electricity for the power grid.
Has a Pipe input so the Fuel supply can be automated.

Resource consumption will automatically be lowered to meet power demands.

buildings.name: Geothermal Generator
buildings.description: Can only be built on geyser nodes.\nGenerates electricity for your power grid.\nDoes not require any resources to be input.

buildings.name: Nuclear Power Plant
buildings.description:
Consumes Nuclear Fuel Rods and Water to produce electricty for the power grid.

Produces Nuclear Waste, which is extracted from the conveyor belt output.

Resource consumption will automatically be lowered to meet power demands.

buildings.name: Stackable Hyper Tube Support
buildings.description: Support for Hyper Tubes. Can be stacked on other stackable supports.

buildings.name: Hyper Tube Wall Hole
buildings.description: Can be attached to walls to allow Hyper Tubes to pass through them.

buildings.name: Hyper Tube Wall Support
buildings.description: Can be attached to walls. \nSupports for Hyper Tubes to allow for longer distances.

buildings.name: Industrial Fluid Buffer
buildings.description: Can contain up to 2400m³ of fluid.\nHas an in and output for pipes.

buildings.name: U-Jelly Landing Pad
buildings.description: Generates a speed dampening jelly.\nGuarantees a safe landing.

buildings.name: Electric Locomotive
buildings.description:
This locomotive is used to move Freight Cars from station to station.
Requires 25-110MW of Power to drive.
Must be built on railway.
Named 'Leif' by FISCIT pioneers because of its reliability.

buildings.name: Lookout Tower
buildings.description: Provides a good OVERVIEW useful for building.

buildings.name: M.A.M.
buildings.description: The Molecular Analysis Machine is used to analyse new and exotic materials found on alien planets.\nR&D will assist Pioneers through the M.A.M. to turn any valuable data into usable research options and new technologies.

buildings.name: Manufacturer
buildings.description: Crafts three or four parts into another part.\n\nCan be automated by feeding parts into it with a conveyor belt connected to the input. The produced parts can be automatically extracted by connecting a conveyor belt to the output.

buildings.name: Miner Mk.1
buildings.description: Extracts solid resources from the resource node it is built on. \nThe normal extraction rate is 60 resources per minute. \nThe extraction rate is modified depending on resource node purity. Outputs all extracted resources onto connected conveyor belts.

buildings.name: Miner Mk.2
buildings.description: Extracts solid resources from the resource node it is built on. \nThe normal extraction rate is 120 resources per minute. \nThe extraction rate is modified depending on resource node purity. Outputs all extracted resources onto connected conveyor belts.

buildings.name: Miner Mk.3
buildings.description: Extracts solid resources from the resource node it is built on. \nThe normal extraction rate is 240 resources per minute. \nThe extraction rate is modified depending on resource node purity. Outputs all extracted resources onto connected conveyor belts.

buildings.name: Oil Extractor
buildings.description:
Normal extraction rate: 120m³ oil per minute.
Head Lift: 10 meters.
(Allows fluids to be transported 10 meters upwards.)

Can be build on an Oil Node to extract Crude Oil. Extraction rates depend on node purity.

buildings.name: Refinery
buildings.description:
Refines fluid and/or solid parts into other parts.
Head Lift: 10 meters.
(Allows fluids to be transported 10 meters upwards.)

Contains both a Conveyor Belt and Pipe input and output, to allow for the automation of various recipes.

buildings.name: Packager
buildings.description:
Used for the packaging and unpacking of fluids.
Head Lift: 10 meters.
(Allows fluids to be transported 10 meters upwards.)

Contains both a Conveyor Belt and Pipe input and output, to allow for the automation of various recipes.

buildings.name: Pillar Base
buildings.description: Provides a flat floor to build your factory on. \nBuildings on top of the foundation are adjusted to a grid, to make it easier to line them up to each other.

buildings.name: Pillar Middle
buildings.description: Provides a flat floor to build your factory on. \nBuildings on top of the foundation are adjusted to a grid, to make it easier to line them up to each other.

buildings.name: Pillar Top
buildings.description: Provides a flat floor to build your factory on. \nBuildings on top of the foundation are adjusted to a grid, to make it easier to line them up to each other.

buildings.name: Hyper Tube Entrance
buildings.description: Used to enter and power a Hyper Tube.

buildings.name: Hyper Tube Support
buildings.description: Supports for Hyper Tubes to allow for longer distances.

buildings.name: Hyper Tube
buildings.description: Tubes for transporting FICSIT employees.\nA Hyper Tube Entrance needs to be attached to power and enter a Hyper Tube system.

buildings.name: Fluid Buffer
buildings.description: Can contain up to 400m³ of fluid.\nHas an in and output for pipes.

buildings.name: Stackable Pipeline Support
buildings.description: Support for pipelines. Can be stacked on other stackable supports.

buildings.name: Pipeline Junction Cross
buildings.description: Can be attached to a pipeline to split it 4-way.

buildings.name: Pipeline Mk.2
buildings.description: Outside indicators show volume, flow rate and direction.\nTransports up to 600m³ of fluid per minute.\nUsed to transport fluids.

buildings.name: Pipeline Pump Mk.2
buildings.description:
Can be attached to a Pipeline to apply Head Lift.
Maximum Head Lift: 50 meters
(Allows fluids to be transported 50 meters upwards.)

NOTE: Has an in- and output direction.
NOTE: Head Lift does not stack, so space between Pumps is recommended.

buildings.name: Pipeline Pump Mk.1
buildings.description:
Can be attached to a Pipeline to apply Head Lift.
Maximum Head Lift: 20 meters
(Allows fluids to be transported 20 meters upwards.)

NOTE: Has an in- and output direction.
NOTE: Head Lift does not stack, so space between Pumps is recommended.

buildings.name: Pipeline Wall Hole
buildings.description: Can be attached to walls, allowing Pipelines to pass through them.

buildings.name: Pipeline Wall Support
buildings.description: Can be attached to walls.\nUsed to connect Pipelines over longer distances.

buildings.name: Pipeline Support
buildings.description: Can be used as a connection for pipelines. The height of the support can be adjusted.\nUseful to route pipelines in a more controlled manner and over long distances.

buildings.name: Pipeline Mk.1
buildings.description: Outside indicators show volume, flow rate and direction.\nTransports up to 300m³ of fluid per minute.\nUsed to transport fluids.

buildings.name: Power Line
buildings.description: Used to connect Power Poles, Power Generators and Factory buildings.

buildings.name: Power Pole Mk.1
buildings.description: Can handle up to 4 Power Line connections.\n\nConnect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Power Pole Mk.2
buildings.description: Can handle up to 7 Power Line connections.\n\nConnect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Power Pole Mk.3
buildings.description: Can handle up to 10 Power Line connections.\n\nConnect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Double Wall Outlet Mk.1
buildings.description:
Power Pole that attaches to a wall. Has one connector on each side of the wall.

Can handle up to 4 Power Line connections.

Connect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Double Wall Outlet Mk.2
buildings.description:
Power Pole that attaches to a wall. Has one connector on each side of the wall.

Can handle up to 7 Power Line connections.

Connect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Double Wall Outlet Mk.3
buildings.description:
Power Pole that attaches to a wall. Has one connector on each side of the wall.

Can handle up to 10 Power Line connections.

Connect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Wall Outlet Mk.1
buildings.description:
Power Pole that attaches to a wall.

Can handle up to 4 Power Line connections.

Connect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Wall Outlet Mk.2
buildings.description:
Power Pole that attaches to a wall.

Can handle up to 7 Power Line connections.

Connect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Wall Outlet Mk.3
buildings.description:
Power Pole that attaches to a wall.

Can handle up to 10 Power Line connections.

Connect Power Poles, Power Generators and factory buildings together with Power Lines to create a power grid. The power grid supplies the connected buildings with power.

buildings.name: Inner-Corner Quarter Pipe
buildings.description: Provides an optional factory look that is smoother and offers possibilities for recreational activities. \nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Inverted Inner-Corner Quarter Pipe
buildings.description: Provides an optional factory look that is smoother and offers possibilities for recreational activities. \nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Outer-Corner Quarter Pipe
buildings.description: Provides an optional factory look that is smoother and offers possibilities for recreational activities. \nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Inverted Outer-Corner Quarter Pipe
buildings.description: Provides an optional factory look that is smoother and offers possibilities for recreational activities. \nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Inverted Quarter Pipe
buildings.description: Provides an optional factory look that is smoother and offers possibilities for recreational activities. \nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Quarter Pipe
buildings.description: Provides an optional factory look that is smoother and offers possibilities for recreational activities. \nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Radar Tower
buildings.description: Reveals an area around itself on the map. The area grows over time to a max.\nPlacing the tower higher up increases the max area revealed.

buildings.name: Railway
buildings.description: Used to transport trains in a reliable and fast manner.\nHas a wide turn angle so make sure to plan it out properly.

buildings.name: Double Ramp 8m x 2m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Double Ramp 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Inverted Ramp 8m x 1m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Up Corner   8m x 1m Inverted
buildings.description: Inverted Ramps mostly provide aesthetic options.\nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Down Corner 8m x 1m Inverted
buildings.description: Inverted Ramps mostly provide aesthetic options.\nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Inverted Ramp 8m x 2m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Up Corner   8m x 2m Inverted
buildings.description: Inverted Ramps mostly provide aesthetic options.\nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Down Corner 8m x 2m Inverted
buildings.description: Inverted Ramps mostly provide aesthetic options.\nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Up Corner   8m x 4m Inverted
buildings.description: Inverted Ramps mostly provide aesthetic options.\nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Down Corner 8m x 4m Inverted
buildings.description: Inverted Ramps mostly provide aesthetic options.\nStill utilizes the standard foundation building grid for improved building placement.

buildings.name: Ramp 8m x 1m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Ramp 8m x 2m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Ramp 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Inverted Ramp 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Double Ramp 8m x 8m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations to make it easier to get on top of them. Works especially well with vehicles.

buildings.name: Down Corner Ramp 8m x 1m
buildings.description: Ramps make it easier to get up onto Foundations for Pioneers and their Vehicles.\nHeight: 1

buildings.name: Up Corner Ramp 8m x 1m
buildings.description: Ramps make it easier to get up onto Foundations for Pioneers and their Vehicles.\nHeight: 1

buildings.name: Down Corner Ramp 8m x 2m
buildings.description: Ramps make it easier to get up onto Foundations for Pioneers and their Vehicles.\nHeight: 2

buildings.name: Up Corner Ramp 8m x 2m
buildings.description: Ramps make it easier to get up onto Foundations for Pioneers and their Vehicles.\nHeight: 2

buildings.name: Down Corner Ramp 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Ramps make it easier to get up onto Foundations for Pioneers and their Vehicles.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Up Corner Ramp 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Ramps make it easier to get up onto Foundations for Pioneers and their Vehicles.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: AWESOME Shop
buildings.description:
Redeem your FICSIT Coupons here! 
For those employees going the extra kilometer we have set aside special bonus milestones and rewards! Get your Coupons in the AWESOME Sink program now!

*No refunds possible.

buildings.name: AWESOME Sink
buildings.description: Got excess resources? Fear not, for FICSIT does not waste! The newly developed AWESOME Sink turns any useful part straight into research data, as fast as you can supply it! \nParticipating pioneers will be compensated with Coupons to be spend at the AWESOME Shop.

buildings.name: Smelter
buildings.description: Smelts ore into ingots.\n\nCan be automated by feeding ore into it with a conveyor belt connected to the input. The produced ingots can be automatically extracted by connecting a conveyor belt to the output.

buildings.name: Space Elevator
buildings.description: Requires deliveries of special Project Parts to complete Phases of Project Assembly.\nCompleting Phases in the Space Elevator will unlock new Tiers in the HUB Terminal.

buildings.name: Stairs Left
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations.\nMakes it easier to get to other floors of your structures.

buildings.name: Stairs Right
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations.\nMakes it easier to get to other floors of your structures.

buildings.name: Storage Container
buildings.description: Contains 24 slots for storing large amounts of items.\nHas an input and output for conveyor belts.

buildings.name: Industrial Storage Container
buildings.description: Contains 48 slots for storing large amounts of items.\nHas two inputs and outputs for conveyor belts.

buildings.name: Personal Storage Box
buildings.description: Contains 25 slots for storing large amounts of items.

buildings.name: Tractor
buildings.description: 25 slot inventory. Has a built in Craft Bench. Can be automated to pick up and deliver resources at Truck Stations. Nicknamed the Sugarcube by FICSIT pioneers.

buildings.name: The HUB
buildings.description: The heart of your factory. This is where you complete FICSIT milestones to unlock additional blueprints of buildings, vehicles, parts, equipment etc.

buildings.name: Fluid Freight Platform
buildings.description:
Freight Cars that stop at the Freight Platform will be loaded or unloaded by the Freight Platform.
Loading and unloading options can be set inside the building.
Snaps to other Platforms, Stations, and Rails.
Needs to be connected to a powered Railway to function.

buildings.name: Freight Platform
buildings.description:
Freight Cars that stop at the Freight Platform will be loaded or unloaded by the Freight Platform.
Loading and unloading options can be set inside the building.
Snaps to other Platforms, Stations, and Rails.
Needs to be connected to a powered Railway to function.

buildings.name: Empty Platform
buildings.description: An empty train platform for when you need to create some empty space.

buildings.name: Train Station
buildings.description: Locomotives can be set to drive to and stop at the Train Station.\nYou can connect power to the train station to power up the trains on the railway as well as transport the power to other stations.

buildings.name: Truck Station
buildings.description:
Either send or receive resources to vehicles. Has an inventory with 48 slots.
Transfers up to 120 stacks per minute to/from docked vehicle. 
Always refuels vehicles if it has access to a matching fuel type.

buildings.name: Truck
buildings.description: 48 slot inventory. Has a built in Craft Bench. Can be automated to pick up and deliver resources at Truck Stations. Nicknamed the Unit by FICSIT pioneers because of its massive frame.

buildings.name: Valve
buildings.description:
Used to limit Pipeline flow rates.
Can be attached to a Pipeline.

NOTE: Has an in- and output direction.

buildings.name: Walkway Crossing
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walkways.\nSpecifically made for humans to walk on.

buildings.name: Walkway Ramp
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walkways.\nSpecifically made for humans to walk on.

buildings.name: Walkway Straight
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walkways.\nSpecifically made for humans to walk on.

buildings.name: Walkway T-Crossing
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walkways.\nSpecifically made for humans to walk on.

buildings.name: Walkway Turn
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walkways.\nSpecifically made for humans to walk on.

buildings.name: Wall 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nUseful for building multi-floor structures.

buildings.name: Wall 8m x 4m
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nUseful for building multi-floor structures.

buildings.name: Wall Conveyor x3
buildings.description: Walls connect to other Walls and Floors. Use these to make buildings with several floors.\nHas 3 conveyor belt connections.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Wall Conveyor x3
buildings.description: Walls connect to other Walls and Floors. Use these to make buildings with several floors.\nHas 3 conveyor belt connections.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Wall Conveyor x2
buildings.description: Walls connect to other Walls and Floors. Use these to make buildings with several floors.\nHas 2 conveyor belt connections.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Wall Conveyor x2
buildings.description: Walls connect to other Walls and Floors. Use these to make buildings with several floors.\nHas 2 conveyor belt connections.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Wall Conveyor x1
buildings.description: Walls connect to other Walls and Floors. Use these to make buildings with several floors.\nHas 1 conveyor belt connection.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Wall Conveyor x1
buildings.description: Walls connect to other Walls and Floors. Use these to make buildings with several floors.\nHas 1 conveyor belt connection.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Wall Conveyor Perpendicular
buildings.description: Walls connect to other Walls and Floors. Use these to make buildings with several floors.\nHas 1 conveyor belt connection perpendicular to the wall.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Wall Conveyor Perpendicular
buildings.description: Walls connect to other Walls and Floors. Use these to make buildings with several floors.\nHas 1 conveyor belt connection perpendicular to the wall.\nHeight: 4

buildings.name: Center Door Wall
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe door allows Pioneers to pass through the wall.

buildings.name: Center Door Wall
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe door allows Pioneers to pass through the wall.

buildings.name: Left Door Wall
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe door allows Pioneers to pass through the wall.

buildings.name: Left Door Wall
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe door allows Pioneers to pass through the wall.

buildings.name: Right Door Wall
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe door allows Pioneers to pass through the wall.

buildings.name: Right Door Wall
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe door allows Pioneers to pass through the wall.

buildings.name: Gate Wall
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe gate allows Pioneers to pass through the wall.

buildings.name: Single Window
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe window allows Pioneers to see through the wall.

buildings.name: Frame Window
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe windows allow Pioneers to see through the wall.

buildings.name: Panel Window
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe windows allow Pioneers to see through the wall.

buildings.name: Reinforced Window
buildings.description: Snaps to foundations and other walls.\nThe windows allow Pioneers to see through the wall.

buildings.name: Water Extractor
buildings.description:
Default extraction rate: 120m³ water per minute.
Head Lift: 10 meters.
(Allows fluids to be transported 10 meters upwards.)

Extracts water from the body of water it is build on.
Note that the water needs to be deep enough and that rivers do not commonly suffice.

buildings.name: Craft Bench
buildings.description: Allows you to manually craft a large range of different parts. \nThese parts can then be used in construction of different factory buildings, vehicles and equipment.

buildings.name: Equipment Workshop
buildings.description: Used to manually craft equipment.
